For Nursing Students, By Nursing Students

You care for patients.
We care for you.

A safe, anonymous digital space for BSN and MSN students to navigate academic stress, clinical placement anxiety, and the transition to professional practice.

Self-Help Toolkit

Quick tools you can use anytime.

Box Breathing

Regulate your nervous system in 30 seconds.

Ready? Tap Start

Sleep Hygiene

  • No screens 30 mins before bed
  • Room temp cool (18-20°C)
  • No caffeine after 2 PM
Quick Coping Strategies
5-4-3-2-1 Method

Acknowledge 5 things you see, 4 you can touch, 3 you hear, 2 you can smell, and 1 you can taste.

Brain Dump

Set a timer for 3 minutes. Write down everything worrying you on paper. Then rip it up.

Connect with a Peer

Matched based on your topic. Confidential. Asynchronous.

How it works

  • Fill out the request form.
  • Matched within 24 hours.
  • Receive secure chat link via email.

Stress & Burnout

Nursing burnout is physical, mental, and emotional exhaustion caused by chronic workplace stress. It is not your fault.

Common Signs

  • Dreading clinicals/work.
  • Feeling cynical with patients.
  • Physical fatigue after sleeping.

Immediate Action: The "3-Minute Reset"

Step into a supply room. Drink water slowly. Do one cycle of box breathing. Remind yourself: "I am doing my best."

Exam Anxiety

The NCLEX tests critical thinking, not just memory. Anxiety blocks that pathway.

The Stop Light Method

  • Green: Know it? Mark it, move on.
  • Yellow: Narrowed to two? Pick your gut.
  • Red: No idea? Don't panic. Guess. Move on.
